title: Luke Dyer
text:
Luke Dyer (born ) is a former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 2000s and 2010s. Dyer had played at representative level for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>, the <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage № 844</a>), the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>, the (Celtic) <a href="Crusaders%20Rugby%20League">Crusaders</a>, and the <a href="Central%20Comets">Central Comets</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>, as a , or .
Background.
Dyer was born in <a href="Penrith%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Penrith, New South Wales, Australia</a>.
Playing career.
Dyer played for the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> in the 2004 <a href="Rugby%20League%20World%20Sevens">Rugby League World Sevens</a> pre-season tournament. He was later released by Melbourne, returning to <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> during the <a href="2004%20NRL%20season">2004 NRL season</a>, making his NRL debut for Penrith against Melbourne in round 17.
Dyer represented for Wales in <a href="2008%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">Rugby League World Cup</a> qualifying matches.
Dyer scored the Crusaders first and only try in their first game in the Super League.
